question: Build-A-Bear put a twist on buying cuddly toys by providing consumers with the ability to modify and personalize their toys. What type of positioning strategy did Build-A-Bear use?

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: That’s not correct. You may be thinking of niche marketing strategy, which focuses on a unique target market.
That’s not correct. With head-to-head positioning, you’re directly competing on similar product attributes in the market.
That’s not correct. An undifferentiated marketing strategy focuses on an entire market rather than a segment of it.
Differentiated positioning is based on the differentiating characteristics or qualities that make your product/service/brand better than those of your competitors.

detailedSolution: Differentiated positioning is based on the differentiating characteristics or qualities that make your product/service/brand better than those of your competitors.
